column5: Add a short section to docs listing required screens (blocks, chat, controls, logs, settings) and the minimal backend APIs; doc is readable in <5 minutes
Docs specify required env vars (DATABASE_URL or PG* vars, PORT, SECRET_KEY) and how to copy from .env.example; includes one command to validate env
Backend loads .env in dev (without committing secrets); starting backend without DB prints a clear error listing missing vars
A CLI or startup check can connect to Postgres using env config and run `SELECT 1`; fails fast with actionable error
Add a small script/command to apply `backend/schema.sql` to the configured DB; running it twice is idempotent or clearly warns without crashing
Storage module exposes a single shared connection/pool and simple query helpers; backend starts and can fetch server time from DB
`GET /api/health` returns ok with DB connectivity status; `GET /api/version` returns app name + git-less build/version string
Docs list request/response shapes for: inbox messages, pipeline controls, logs, and settings; includes example JSON payloads
Create DB table for inbox messages; implement `GET /api/inbox` (latest N) and `POST /api/inbox` (create) with basic validation
Create DB table for pipeline state; implement `GET /api/pipeline` to return state (stopped/running/paused) and timestamps
Implement `POST /api/pipeline/start|stop|pause|resume`; state transitions are enforced (e.g. cannot pause if stopped) and return 400 with reason on invalid transitions
Backend can start the driver/pipeline as a subprocess, stop it, and detect exit; no orphan processes after stop
Backend captures subprocess stdout/stderr into a rolling buffer and optionally persists last N lines in DB; `GET /api/logs?since=<id>` returns incremental lines
PWA loads offline-friendly shell with a clean light theme; includes top bar, left blocks palette, center workspace, right inspector/logs panel
PWA has a small API client module; shows health, DB status, and pipeline state badge; updates at least every 2 seconds or via push
PWA shows inbox list and compose box; sending a message posts to backend and appears in list without full page reload
PWA renders a minimal block palette (3-6 blocks) and supports dragging blocks into a workspace; workspace serializes to JSON

column4: Convert blocks to pipeline plan payload
column5: Workspace JSON can be transformed into a backend-recognized plan payload; add a UI button that posts the plan to backend and gets an ack
Buttons call the pipeline control endpoints; UI disables invalid actions based on current state and shows error text on 400
Logs panel polls or streams incremental logs and auto-scrolls with a pause toggle; user can copy selected text
Settings panel lets user pick agent/model options (persisted via backend); selection survives reload
Docs include a deterministic manual test: start backend, apply schema, open PWA, send inbox msg, drag blocks, start pipeline, see logs, pause/resume, stop

column4: Standard pipeline script format + IR spec
column5: Docs define a standardized formatted pipeline script + IR schema (TASK->STEP->ACTION) including action references/definitions, toolchains, languages, materials/context paths, and meta-round loops; includes at least one complete example and explicit mapping to Scratch-like blocks
Backend adds DB tables and minimal CRUD endpoints to persist pipeline scripts and parsed IR; PWA can save and reload by id
Backend implements a deterministic parser for the standardized formatted script into IR; invalid input returns actionable errors and never executes code
Backend can import an annotated shell pipeline script (e.g. via structured comments) into IR with clear limitations; at least one example imports successfully
PWA adds a Script panel: paste/import script -> call backend parse -> render as blocks on the canvas; user can switch between raw script and blocks view
PWA can export the current blocks/IR as the standardized formatted script and a generated runnable shell driver; outputs are downloadable as files
Repo includes a script/template that generates a runnable shell driver from IR (Codex non-interactive calls + reusable actions); generation is deterministic
Docs define standard folders (materials/interactions/outputs/docs/references/scripts/tools/logs/auto-apps) and how AutoAppDev uses them; includes a simple init checklist
Backend provides an optional endpoint that uses Codex (non-interactive) to convert arbitrary pipeline scripts into IR; runs with strict guardrails and timeouts, and stores provenance + prompts
Docs define an `update_readme` ACTION (markers + philosophy section) and how it targets a workspace README under auto-apps/ without arbitrary path writes
Backend exposes a safe endpoint to patch a workspace README between markers; rejects paths outside auto-apps/ and logs changes

column4: Add Update README block to palette
column5: PWA adds an Update README block and exports it into the formatted script/IR; UI makes clear which workspace README it targets
Backend stores action definitions in Postgres (prompt- and command-based) and exposes minimal CRUD endpoints with validation and safe defaults
PWA can list/create/edit action definitions (prompt template, agent/model, or command/script reference) and persists changes via backend without reload
Blocks can reference an action definition (by id/slug) and export includes that reference; defaults remain backwards compatible for simple blocks
Backend stores per-workspace config (materials path(s), shared context text/file reference, default language) with safe path rules (under auto-apps/) and exposes read/write endpoints
PWA lets the user select a workspace, set materials path, edit shared context, and choose a default language; settings persist and are used when generating scripts/prompts
PWA supports runtime language switching with a built-in language pack: zh-Hans, zh-Hant, en, ja, ko, vi, ar (RTL), fr, es; default remains light theme
Backend provides a safe way for pipelines to write messages/status back to the UI (DB and/or runtime/outbox files) and the PWA can display them

Docs define a standard multi-round pipeline template: for N_ROUND generate/refine tasks from goal+context, then for each task run a configurable action template (plan/work/debug/fix/translate/summary/log/commit)

Docs define a Scratch-like, numbered+indented AAPS convention (still AAPS v1-compatible) and a minimal placeholder syntax (e.g. {{task.title}}, {{task.acceptance}}, {{runtime_dir}}) used in prompts/cmds; includes at least one complete example script using meta_round_v0 + conditional fix steps

`backend/pipeline_parser.py` accepts optional numeric prefixes before KEYWORD (e.g. `1.2 STEP {...}`) while remaining deterministic; add an example under `examples/` and verify parse via a small python snippet

Generated runners apply deterministic placeholder substitution for `codex_exec.prompt` and `run.cmd` (task/step ids + task list fields + runtime_dir) and document the supported keys; include a smoke check
Generated runners respect `STEP.meta.conditional` (e.g. `on_debug_failure`) so fix steps run only when previous debug/run actions fail; include an example IR + generated runner demonstrating behavior

Generated runners implement meta_round_v0: run controller round steps, read `task_list_path` JSON, then loop tasks and apply a template task (`TASK.meta.task_template_v0`) with placeholder substitution; persist resume state under runtime so reruns skip completed tasks
Script panel exports numbered+indented AAPS lines and import tolerates optional numeric prefixes; UI renders numbering/indent for readability without changing semantics
Runner template adds a helper to write progress updates to `runtime/outbox/` (no HTTP required) and meta-round loop uses it so the PWA can observe progress
